intro: Homolepis isocalycina, commonly known as the broad-leafed bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
